subject: Education
title: Education and Innovation: Do Schools Create Entrepreneurs?
description: A short lesson to help you apply Education and Innovation: Do Schools Create Entrepreneurs?.

hook.text: Silicon Valley's biggest names dropped out of college. Does formal education help or hinder innovation?

buildup.text: Countries with higher education levels file more patents. The correlation between schooling and innovation is strong.

discovery.text: But the dropout billionaires had something schools can't teach: access to networks, capital, and risk tolerance.

twist.text: Finland redesigned its curriculum around creativity and entrepreneurship. It didn't produce more startups.

climax.text: Education creates the workforce that supports innovation. The inventors themselves often learn by breaking rules.

punchline.text: School builds the ladder. Entrepreneurs jump off it.

quiz.question: What is the relationship between education levels and patent filings?
options: Higher education correlates with more patents
